reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: British Council - India - Newton Fund

description.narrative: The Newton Fund uses science and innovation partnerships to promote economic development and social welfare of partner countries.

The Newton Fund's primary objective is to reduce poverty by generating and putting into use knowledge and technology to address development challenges and advance development for the poorest people and countries. We will seek to maximise the practical impact of research and innovation to improve the lives and opportunities of the global poor. In achieving this we will grow the research and innovation capacity of developing countries, as well as contributing to the continued strength of the UK’s research and innovation system, and support our wider prosperity and global influence.

To provide development opportunities for PhD students and establish research links between research groups in the UK and India by participating in international intellectual networks, building cultural understanding, and fostering long-term sustainable research collaborations

title.narrative: Professional Development and Engagement - IUATS October 2015

description.narrative: India - UK Advanced Training School for Post Doctorals and early career researchers

To enhance scientific knowledge and awareness through an in-depth course including conducted practical classes by assimilating a mix of faculties and trainees from both countries. The training school will train early career researchers and post doctoral in both the countries in advanced research techniques and methodologies.

title.narrative: Professional Development and Engagement Women in Science December 2016

description.narrative: The workshops on alternate career options for Women in science will support women scientists to provide them training to become tomorrow’s leaders in Science and Technology and its allied careers.

1) To raise awareness and increased knowledge of women scientists To identify and pursue alternative careers in science 2) Enhanced skills of women scientists To pursue career in the field of Science Policy, Science Administration and Science Journalism 3) Creation and support of a professional network of women scientists 4) Emergence of trained women personnel To fulfil evolving needs of Science in India

title.narrative: Researcher Link Workshop Grants April 2015

description.narrative: Joint workshops on priority research areas, with a focus on building capacity of early career researchers

To build sustainable research links between the UK and India and build capacity for engagement in international research collaboration in areas that are identified. Workshops are intended to support research areas relevant to the economic development and welfare of partner countries.
